DomainData.MainInfoText: Cookies are small text files that websites place on your device as you are browsing. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can improve your browsing experience on our website. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose to opt out of certain cookies. Note that this may impact your experience of the site and the services we offer.
DomainData.AlertNoticeText: We use cookies to personalize content and ads, to provide social media features, and to analyze our traffic. We also share information about your use of our site with our partners in social media, advertising, and analytics. By continuing to use our website, you accept the use of all cookies. You can always access and change your cookie preferences in the footer of this website.
DomainData.CookieListDescription: Cookies are small text files that websites place on your device as you are browsing. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can improve your browsing experience on our website. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose to opt out of certain cookies. Note that this may impact your experience of the site and the services we offer.

Groups.GroupDescription: These cookies are essential for you to browse the website and use its features, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in, or filling in forms (which is why you can’t opt out of them).
Groups.GroupDescriptionOTT: These cookies are essential for you to browse the website and use its features, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in, or filling in forms (which is why you can’t opt out of them).

FirstPartyCookies.Name: __cf_bm
FirstPartyCookies.description: The __cf_bm cookie is a cookie necessary to support Cloudflare Bot Management, currently in private beta. As part of our bot management service, this cookie helps manage incoming traffic that matches criteria associated with bots.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: cf_chl_cc_xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
FirstPartyCookies.description: cf_chl_cc_

FirstPartyCookies.Name: OptanonConsent
FirstPartyCookies.description: This cookie is set by the cookie consent solution from OneTrust. It stores information about the categories of cookies the site uses and whether visitors have given or withdrawn consent for the use of each category. This enables site owners to prevent cookies in each category from being set in the users browser, when consent is not given. The cookie has a normal lifespan of one year, so that returning visitors to the site will have their preferences remembered. It contains no information that can identify the site visitor.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: tp-b2b-current-language
FirstPartyCookies.description: Sets user language

FirstPartyCookies.Name: TP.um
FirstPartyCookies.description: Internal state management used by T&T

FirstPartyCookies.Name: tp-b2b-selected-business-unit-id
FirstPartyCookies.description: Stores the id of the current business unit

FirstPartyCookies.Name: crumb
FirstPartyCookies.description: This cookie is associated with SquareSpace.  It is used to ensure a visitor's browsing security. by preventing cross-site request forgery (CSRF).

FirstPartyCookies.Name: appshell-accountselector-hide-selector-modal
FirstPartyCookies.description: Remember whether the user wants to see an account selector when opening the page or not

FirstPartyCookies.Name: appShellUrl
FirstPartyCookies.description: Used for proper appshell caching

FirstPartyCookies.Name: tp-b2b-refresh-token
FirstPartyCookies.description: Business App authentication

FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription: Common cookie name could have a number of different origins.  Where this is first party and a session cookie, its most likely to do with checking to see if the browser is set to block or allow cookies.
FirstPartyCookies.Name: cookietest
FirstPartyCookies.description: Common cookie name could have a number of different origins.  Where this is first party and a session cookie, its most likely to do with checking to see if the browser is set to block or allow cookies.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: OptanonAlertBoxClosed
FirstPartyCookies.description: This cookie is set by websites using certain versions of the cookie law compliance solution from OneTrust.  It is set after visitors have seen a cookie information notice and in some cases only when they actively close the notice down.  It enables the website not to show the message more than once to a user.  The cookie has a one year lifespan and contains no personal information.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: eupubconsent
FirstPartyCookies.description: This cookie is used by the IAB Europe Transparency & Consent Framework to store the user's consent to the data collection Purposes. The cookie holds an encrypted consent string that vendors participating in the framework can read and determine the user's consent.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: appshell-notifications-acknowledged-whats-new
FirstPartyCookies.description: Keep a list of all the product notifications (what's new tab, notifications bell) that have been seen by user

FirstPartyCookies.Name: appshell-notifications-notifications-seen
FirstPartyCookies.description: Keep a list of all the notifications items (bell) that have been clicked by the user

FirstPartyCookies.Name: tp-consumer-id
FirstPartyCookies.description: Account ID (if you sign up or log in)

FirstPartyCookies.Name: tp-b2b-access-token
FirstPartyCookies.description: Business App authentication

FirstPartyCookies.Name: G_ENABLED_IDPS
FirstPartyCookies.description: This cookie is used to securely log in to the website with a Google account.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: firebaseLocalStorageDb
FirstPartyCookies.description: Initialized and used by firebase authentication service

FirstPartyCookies.Name: __cfruid
FirstPartyCookies.description: Cookie associated with sites using CloudFlare, used to identify trusted web traffic.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: __RequestVerificationToken
FirstPartyCookies.description: This is an anti-forgery cookie set by web applications built using ASP.NET MVC technologies. It is designed to stop unauthorised posting of content to a website, known as Cross-Site Request Forgery. It holds no information about the user and is destroyed on closing the browser.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: jwt
FirstPartyCookies.description: Authentication token

Cookies.thirdPartyDescription: This domain is owned by Google Inc. Although Google is primarily known as a search engine, the company provides a diverse range of products and services. Its main source of revenue however is advertising. Google tracks users extensively both through its own products and sites, and the numerous technologies embedded into many millions of websites around the world. It uses the data gathered from most of these services to profile the interests of web users and sell advertising space to organisations based on such interest profiles as well as aligning adverts to the content on the pages where its customer's adverts appear.

Cookies.description: This domain is owned by Google Inc. Although Google is primarily known as a search engine, the company provides a diverse range of products and services. It uses the data gathered from most of these services to profile the interests of web users and sell advertising space to organisations based on such interest profiles as well as aligning adverts to the content on the pages where its customer's adverts appear.

FirstPartyCookies.description: This cookie is set to let Hotjar know whether that visitor is included in the data sampling defined by your site's daily session limit.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: trustpilotABTest
FirstPartyCookies.description:
Lists AB tests running in B2B app with splitTestService from CoreFramework.
When multiple tests are set up they share the same cookie: e.g. {"Onboarding: simplified manual invitation 2":"Variation 1: Control"}

FirstPartyCookies.Name: _hjIncludedInSample
FirstPartyCookies.description: This cookie is associated with web analytics functionality and services from Hot Jar, a Malta based company. It uniquely identifies a visitor during a single browser session and indicates they are included in an audience sample.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: skiftABTest
FirstPartyCookies.description: We regularly test changes on our websites to improve our user experience. This cookie is required to run these tests.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: _gat_UA-nnnnnnn-nn
FirstPartyCookies.description: This is a pattern type cookie set by Google Analytics, where the pattern element on the name contains the unique identity number of the account or website it relates to. It appears to be a variation of the _gat cookie which is used to limit the amount of data recorded by Google on high traffic volume websites.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: amplitude_unsent_de1e2fc13cf22ef1024015ecc1bb8ccd

FirstPartyCookies.Name: _hjid
FirstPartyCookies.description: Hotjar cookie. This cookie is set when the customer first lands on a page with the Hotjar script. It is used to persist the random user ID, unique to that site on the browser. This ensures that behavior in subsequent visits to the same site will be attributed to the same user ID.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: _ga
FirstPartyCookies.description: This cookie name is associated with Google Universal Analytics - which is a significant update to Google's more commonly used analytics service. This cookie is used to distinguish unique users by assigning a randomly generated number as a client identifier. It is included in each page request in a site and used to calculate visitor, session and campaign data for the sites analytics reports.  By default it is set to expire after 2 years, although this is customisable by website owners.

Cookies.thirdPartyDescription: When the Hotjar script executes we try to determine the most generic cookie path we should use, instead of the page hostname. This is done so that cookies can be shared across subdomains (where applicable). To determine this, we try to store the _hjTLDTest cookie for different URL substring alternatives until it fails. After this check, the cookie is removed.
Cookies.Name: _hjTLDTest

This is done so that cookies can be shared across subdomains (where applicable). To determine this, we try to store the _hjTLDTest cookie for different URL substring alternatives until it fails. After this check, the cookie is removed.

Groups.GroupDescription: These cookies track your online activity to help our advertising partners deliver more targeted ads or to limit how many times you see an ad, based on your browsing behavior and internet device.

FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription: These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.

Cookies.thirdPartyDescription: This domain is owned by Google Inc. Although Google is primarily known as a search engine, the company provides a diverse range of products and services. Its main source of revenue however is advertising. Google tracks users extensively both through its own products and sites, and the numerous technologies embedded into many millions of websites around the world. It uses the data gathered from most of these services to profile the interests of web users and sell advertising space to organisations based on such interest profiles as well as aligning adverts to the content on the pages where its customer's adverts appear.

Cookies.thirdPartyDescription: This domain is owned by Facebook, which is the world's largest social networking service.  As a third party host provider, it mostly collects data on the interests of users via widgets such as the 'Like' button found on many websites. In 2014 it also started serving up behaviourally targeted advertising on other websites, similar to most dedicated online marketing companies.

Cookies.thirdPartyDescription: This domain is owned by Google Inc. Although Google is primarily known as a search engine, the company provides a diverse range of products and services. Its main source of revenue however is advertising. Google tracks users extensively both through its own products and sites, and the numerous technologies embedded into many millions of websites around the world. It uses the data gathered from most of these services to profile the interests of web users and sell advertising space to organisations based on such interest profiles as well as aligning adverts to the content on the pages where its customer's adverts appear.

Cookies.thirdPartyDescription: This domain is owned by Yahoo Inc. whose main business model is online advertising. Groups.GroupDescription: These cookies are set by a range of social media services that we have added to the site to enable you to share our content with your friends and networks. They are capable of tracking your browser across other sites and building up a profile of your interests. This may impact the content and messages you see on other websites you visit. If you do not allow these cookies you may not be able to use or see these sharing tools.
